entry.question: If my Snapdragon is in Alt mode, can I repair damage from Snapdragon?
entry.answer: Yes, he only stops repair on other characters.

entry.question: What happens if my Snapdragon is in Alt mode and my opponent plays Involuntary Promotion?
entry.answer: The character brought back from their KO will stay fully repaired because no damage can be moved to it, but the Upgrades from the original character will move as normal.

entry.question: What happens if my Snapdragon is in Bot mode and I play System Reboot?
entry.answer: Both players scrap their whole hand. You draw 4 and scrap none; your opponent draws 4 and scraps 1 card because Snapdragon sees the act of drawing cards as one instance, regardless of number drawn.

entry.question: What happens if my Snapdragon is in Bot mode my Opponent plays a Pep Talk to draw 2 after they draw their first card of the turn, do they scrap 2 cards or 1?
entry.answer: If your opponent has already drawn for turn, whether they draw 1 card with a card like Wedge Formation or 2 cards with a card like Pep Talk, they will only scrap 1 card from hand because of the “1 or more cards” clause.

entry.question: If my Snapdragon KOs and enemy Battle Master, does his Bounty ability work so that I can choose to return that Battle Master to its owner’s hand/KO it from zone-changing?
entry.answer: No, the game operates in all situations as attacking/active player’s abilities all happen, then defending/inactive player’s abilities all happen. Your Bounty trigger will resolve before your opponent’s Battle Master trigger will make them play it.
